meanings.definition: In a sullen or moody manner
meanings.sent1: She walked glumpily to her room after the argument.
meanings.sent2: He stared glumpily out the window on the rainy day.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed glumpily when it couldn't find its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The clouds hung glumpily in the sky, foretelling a storm.
meanings.sent5: The old man sighed glumpily, reminiscing about his youth.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of enthusiasm or cheerfulness
meanings.sent1: The glumpily child refused to join the game.
meanings.sent2: Her glumpily expression dampened the mood of the party.
meanings.sent3: The dog wagged its tail glumpily, not fully engaged in play.
meanings.sent4: The flowers in the garden drooped glumpily under the scorching sun.
meanings.sent5: The student's glumpily attitude affected the whole class.
